channel.title: CVE Feed for ethereum -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for ethereum -- all products

item.title: CVE-2021-39137|2024-08-04T01:58:17.913Z -- ethereum -- go-ethereum
item.description: go-ethereum is the official Go implementation of the Ethereum protocol. In affected versions a consensus-vulnerability in go-ethereum (Geth) could cause a chain split, where vulnerable versions refuse to accept the canonical chain. Further details about the vulnerability will be disclosed at a later date. A patch is included in the upcoming `v1.10.8` release. No workaround are available.

item.title: CVE-2021-41173|2024-08-04T02:59:31.575Z -- ethereum -- go-ethereum
item.description: Go Ethereum is the official Golang implementation of the Ethereum protocol. Prior to version 1.10.9, a vulnerable node is susceptible to crash when processing a maliciously crafted message from a peer. Version v1.10.9 contains patches to the vulnerability. There are no known workarounds aside from upgrading.

item.title: CVE-2024-32972|2024-08-02T02:27:53.323Z -- ethereum -- go-ethereum
item.description: go-ethereum (geth) is a golang execution layer implementation of the Ethereum protocol. Prior to 1.13.15, a vulnerable node can be made to consume very large amounts of memory when handling specially crafted p2p messages sent from an attacker node. The fix has been included in geth version `1.13.15` and onwards.

item.title: CVE-2024-32972|2024-06-04T17:50:49.796Z -- ethereum -- go-ethereum
item.description: go-ethereum (geth) is a golang execution layer implementation of the Ethereum protocol. Prior to 1.13.15, a vulnerable node can be made to consume very large amounts of memory when handling specially crafted p2p messages sent from an attacker node. The fix has been included in geth version `1.13.15` and onwards.
